intro: Valeriana gotvanskyi, commonly known as Gotvanskii valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant, leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white or pink. Valeriana gotvanskyi is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its calming effects.
